sentences.english: Matsumoto says it is very important to him to learn enough about the tradition.
sentences.chinese: 光一说，让他充分学习传统祭典很重要。

sentences.english: Why do Chinese people hold memorial ceremonies for them every year?
sentences.chinese: 为什么中国人对黄帝声势浩大的祭典历久不衰？

sentences.english: This celebration was held in Olympia- the Holy Land of ancient Greece.
sentences.chinese: 这个祭典活动在古希腊的圣地奥林匹亚举行。

sentences.english: The torii is connected with the square and the platform in front of it is an altar for large scale fiesta.
sentences.chinese: 牌坊与广场相连，坊前平台为祖庙大型祭典之祭坛。

sentences.english: Weeks before the festival, troops start packing snow in a frame.
sentences.chinese: 祭典前几个礼拜，军队开始将雪填进框架里。

sentences.english: The ancient Romans held year-end celebrations to honor Saturn( the harvest god) and Mithras( the god of light).
sentences.chinese: 古罗马人举行年终祭典来歌诵他们的农神与太阳神。

sentences.english: Matsumoto Yoshiaki and his son Mastumoto Koichi regularly take part in the festival.
sentences.chinese: 松本吉朗和他的儿子光一，会定期参与这个祭典。

sentences.english: Actually, Taiwan's night market is way much funnier than Japanese Festivals.
sentences.chinese: 说实在话，日本的祭典，还不如台湾的夜市好玩。

sentences.english: The village is disseminating a special kind of count song, is the composition of local fiesta.
sentences.chinese: 村子里传播着一种特殊的数数歌，是祭典的构成局部。

sentences.english: Hanging coffins used to be a unique funeral and sacrifice custom of minority groups during ancient years in southern China.
sentences.chinese: 悬棺过去是中国南方少数民族古代独特的葬仪与祭典。
